content:
Hello,

Are their any Implementation Guides underway to address the use cases defined by the Transparency in Coverage final rule?

Should I move this to implementers?
@Viet Nguyen @Robert Dieterle
Yes -- Da Vinci has a Cost Transparency use case. I am reviewing the Final Rule to determine how it will impact the scope of the use case and the resulting FHIR IG.

Thanks, this is great information.

Is the goal to have a STU1 publication to address the 1/1/2022 data file requirement?

If my reading is correct, every implementer will probably have a custom format. The final rule mentioned the possibility of a technical standard requirement in the future.

Lloyd McKenzie said:

Viet Nguyen Robert Dieterle

The PSS at confluence says ST2 period begins at Sept 2021. Does that mean there would be an IG available by that time? Basically when can we expect an IG, profiles, artifatcs- the works, for this project? @Lloyd McKenzie @Robert Dieterle @Viet Nguyen
Can you provide a link to the PSS @Tushar Nair?

Lloyd McKenzie said:

Can you provide a link to the PSS Tushar Nair?

@Lloyd McKenzie https://confluence.hl7.org/display/FM/PSS+for+Patient+Cost+Transparancy
@Robert Dieterle @Viet Nguyen - we should probably get FM to update the PSS timeline

Lloyd McKenzie said:

Robert Dieterle Viet Nguyen - we should probably get FM to update the PSS timeline

@Lloyd McKenzie is there a prospective date for this? I mean I understand if it's not cast in stone but even a guesstimate would help.

I don't think any work has happened on this IG at all to date. (If it has, it's been done under a different name - nothing has yet been committed to to the github project for the IG.) Bob or Viet would need to comment on current plans.
CMS has published a standard for the cost files
This use case was not started earlier due to other priorities. The official kickoff for Cost Transparency will be later this month for the STU1.
